channel.title: Most Popular on Damien Saunders
channel.description: Recent content in Most Popular on Damien Saunders

item.title: Top Posts June 2011
item.description: Ahh June … how we loved you … first it was drier then a dusty desert here in the UK, then wetter then wet and finally … So, In case you were living underground here are the most popular posts that you missed from last month: [wpp order_by=”views” range=”monthly” pages=”0″ stats_comments=0 stats_views=1]

item.title: Most Popular December 2010
item.description: December 2010 has been and gone … so it’s Happy New Year and welcome 2011. Just in case you were stuck under a rock for the past month, here’s a few of my most read posts. [wpp pages=”0” order_by=”views” range=”monthly” stats_comments=0 cats_to_exclude=”1″]

item.title: Most Popular Posts for 2010 a year in review
item.description: **2010 has been and gone … so it’s time to welcome 2011. It’s been a busy year even though it had no deviation of its 365 expected length in days. I guess 2010 just had more tough days then easy days! What do you think?** A Year in Review– 2010 the stats more than 24,000unique visitors from 153countries according to Alexa.com my website ranks in the Top 5%of websites and currently sites around 836,000

item.title: Most Popular Posts – October
item.description: So it’s November – and that means cold days, cold nights and clear skies for fireworks! If you missed out reading some of the best social media news and stuff from October then try these: [ id=”1715″ type=”post”]Android – 4 of the best WiFi Apps[/] [ id=”1703″ type=”post”]9 step guide to Foursquare[/] [ id=”1691″ type=”post”]Social Media & Internet Usage Policies for Workplaces[/] and to get the best news – then sign-up for my social media monthly news

item.title: September Most Popular Posts
item.description: So September has been and gone and now we are into October … The annoying thing about October is that half the world is celebrating spring and half the world is thinking about the last few weeks of summer time 🙁and in other news – I’m back in the UK after spending summer working in Lithuania. Which means it must be time to start organising drinks and networking stuff around Startup Weekend again.
